definition: to recognize people (of babies)/to be able to tell people apart
to recognize/to know/to admit
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to fall out with sb and become hostile
erhua variant of 認人|认人[ren4 ren2]

sentences.english: From now on, therefore, we regard no one according to the flesh.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我们从今以后，不凭著外貌认人了。

sentences.english: How do you think your inability to recognize faces affected the development of your social life?
sentences.chinese: 你如何看待无法识认人面对你社交生活发展的影响？

sentences.english: They're revenue driven, not people driven.
sentences.chinese: 他们只认营业收入，不认人。

sentences.english: He is face blind, so he has difficulty recognizing people right away.
sentences.chinese: 他有认人的困难，很难马上认出谁是谁。

definition: shy with strangers
to know how to count and do sums/numerate/numeracy
literate/knowing how to read
to visit new in-laws after a marriage
to own up to a fault/to admit the truth/to acknowledge a debt
to act shamelessly/to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc/to act dumb/to act as if sth never happened
to fall out with sb and become hostile
exceptionally bright kid/child prodigy
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to admit an error/to acknowledge one's mistake
(coll.) new-born baby/young boy
shameless/(slang) rascal
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
important person
(coll.) puppy/(derog.) son of a bitch
memory (ability to retain information)
